title: ReFi Medellín with Tereza Bízková and Juan Giraldo | S3 BONUS episode
html:
In this bonus episode of the ReFi Podcast, John Ellison sits down with the new co-hosts of season 4, Maya Dentzel and Tereza Bízková, along with her colleague Juan Giraldo from ReFi Medellín, ReFi DAO’s local node. They discuss the incredible work being done in Medellín, Colombia, to drive the Web3 movement through community events and sustainable practices.

ReFi Medellín has hosted over 35 events in the past year, focusing on activities that bring people together and promote regeneration. From hikes and planting community gardens to urban farming and blockchain education, this local node is making a significant impact.

“Living in Medellín, it’s easy to notice the need for ReFi. Colombia is the second most biodiverse country in the world, and there are many social issues. Seeing how Web3 can become a coordination tool for us was a huge motivation.” - Tereza
🎵 LISTEN ON SPOTIFY

Key Takeaways 🚀

  • Engaging Onboarding: ReFi Medellín uses activities like urban farming work, clean-up competitions, and free English classes to introduce Web3 concepts, addressing skepticism and access issues in the community.
  • Tackling Financial Barriers: They offer low-interest, collateral-free loans based on community reputation, supporting local groups underserved by the traditional financial system.
  • Collaborative Growth: By partnering with local NGOs like Salva Terra and engaging in global discussions, ReFi Medellín aims to create a robust network of partners to grow with.
  • Intentional Fundraising: ReFi Medellín’s fundraising success via Gitcoin, Giveth, and Optimism RetroPGF is due to intentional work focused on monitoring opportunities, checking requirements, and spending significant time on community chats.

Tune into the full episode on YouTube or Spotify, and follow ReFi Medellin on Twitter! 🌱

Inspired by ReFi Medellín? Make a difference by starting a local node in your community. 🌎

Sneak Peek to Season 4 👀

In this episode, Maya and Tereza also offer a sneak peek into what’s coming for the next season of the ReFi Podcast. Maya emphasizes their goal to expand on the concept of Regenerative Finance and delve deeper into the entire regeneration spectrum, including foundational philosophy, economic principles, and innovative technologies and projects.

Tereza echoes this new direction by introducing the season’s theme, “Regeneration Nexus,” with the aim to “tell an integral regenerative story.” She explains that this story will bring together three key elements: the system, economic thinking, and real-world impact.

Stay tuned for more, and follow the ReFi Podcast on YouTube and Spotify! 💜
